definition: Palace in the Moon (in folk tales)
moon/month/monthly/CL:個|个[ge4],輪|轮[lun2]
palace/temple/castration (as corporal punishment)/first note in pentatonic scale
surname Gong

sentences.english: And outside the palace, there was a sweet-scented osmanthus tree and a lumberjack called Wu Gang.
sentences.chinese: 月宮外，還有一棵桂花樹和一個叫吳剛的伐樹人。

sentences.english: According to the legend, the fairies from the Moon Palace would pour down sweet dews to the mortal world.
sentences.chinese: 傳說中秋這天晚上，月宮的仙女會把甘露灑向人間。

sentences.english: It is much more beautiful here than the moon.
Moon palace is the beautiful hotel in the moon.
sentences.chinese: 月宮月亮是美麗的酒店。

definition: underground palace of ghouls, e.g. Asgard of Scandinavian mythology
bejeweled jade palace (idiom); sumptuous dwelling
see 楊貴妃|杨贵妃[Yang2 Gui4 fei1]
elegant name/honorific
to hide (from the world)
sky clears after rain/new hopes after a disastrous period (idiom)/every cloud has a silver lining (idiom)/see also 雨過天晴|雨过天晴[yu3 guo4 tian1 qing2]
tuning/temperament
Longsha district of Qiqihar city 齊齊哈爾|齐齐哈尔[Qi2 qi2 ha1 er3], Heilongjiang
full moon
(literary) to practice medicine/to work as a pharmacist
lit. twin lotus flowers on one stalk/fig. a devoted married couple
fairyland/honorific: your homeland
Yama, King of Hell/translation of Sanskrit: Yama Raja
insect or insect-like small creature (literary)/base person (used as a curse word)
luan and phoenix/husband and wife/virtuous person/sovereign/belle
itinerant monk (loanword from Sanskrit)
